newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan two-month NCD average yield at 5.482 pct.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan two-month NCD average yield at 5.482 pct.

text.p: Taiwan's central bank issued T$3 billion in two-month negotiable certificates of deposit on Friday at an average yield of 5.482 percent, a central bank official said.
The range of the bids was between 5.400 and 5.500 percent.

The central bank repeatedly issued NCDs during a sustained stock rally in March and April, a move widely seen as aiming to keep a lid on the loose liquidity that many experts said had been fuelling what was then a sizzling stock market.
The central bank has confirmed that it was responding to the liquidity sitution but denied that it was acting directly in response to the stock market bull run.
The stock market has entered a consolidation in May, with daily turnover plunging to less than half of the record levels set during the big first-quarter rally.
